Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @blackjok3r  `once I can figure out how to remove the pubkeys from the source code` <-- i got something for you relevant to that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @blackjok3r i have factored out notary node addresses to their own header file

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: that allows external coins to seemlessly hardfork upgrade to new NN's each year, buy simply copying a file from komodo.git into their repo

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I suggest you emulate this file structure: https://github.com/leto/kreds-core/commit/155e065492dbb2e7ed98d9f016f8ce55aa40470b

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but each years pubkeys need to be there so it can sync KMD

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: `src/komodo_notaries.h` is the new file

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @jl777c it contains all years addresses, the header file

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: and actually, only pubkeys and addrs on KMD, addrs on that chain are dynamically generated now

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: so yes, the coin updating KMD notaries must change the name of 1 variable in their code, in addition to copying the new file

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: I hope that is not too much

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, with a timestamp range check for each set of pubkeys

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: the goal is to avoid having people manually changing NN pubkeys in a file, when they could just copy a known-good + trusted file from KMD

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, good to do that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: yes, your code uses timestamps to choose which set of notary pubkeys to use

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if sha256(komodo_notaries.h) is the same value in latest KMD (i will have to send a PR to kmd) and an external coin, that is a good indication that all NN pubkeys are correct, nothing has been tampered with or accidentally broken. If they are not, something is wrong. It feels like a nice kind of sanity check to have.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I already made functions that separate timestamps there is a definable gap between each era and it was tested working. What I need to do is be able to fetch the arrays these functions use from an oracle and load them into the deamon, guess it would fetch it then restart before syncing. This allows adding an extra timestamp, or just a whole new set of keys for a new chain or chains, without having to recompile the code..

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Maybe I'm over over thinking it, as usual and I'm sure a simple solution will become apparent when required
